pages.text: 282 THE LAW REPORTS ACT, 1875 ACT NO. XVIII OF 1875 [13th October, 1875] An Act for the improvement of Law Reports. Preamble [Repealed bv the Government of India (Adaptation of Indian Laws) Order, 1937. | Short title 1. This Act may be called the Law Reports Act, 1875. Local extent It extends to the whole of '|Bangladesh]. Commencement *[And it shall come into force at once]. 2. |Repealed bv the Repealing Act, 1876 (Act No. XII of 1876). | Authority given 3. No Court shall be bound to hear cited, or shall receive oniy te 4 or treat as an authority binding on it, the report of any case uthorize . . re decided *|* * *] by “[the Supreme Court], other than a report ports : lips published under the authority of [Government]. Authority 4. Nothing herein contained shall be construed to give to or duaicial any judicial decision any further or other authority than it ecisic ne would have had if this Act had not been passed. ' ‘The words "Bangladesh" and "Government" were substituted. for the words "Pakistan" and “a Provincial Government" respectively by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act. 1973 (Act No. VIIPof 1973). > Third paragraph of section | was substituted. for the original third paragraph by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act. 1973 (Act No. VII of 1973). The words “on or after the said day" were omitted by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act. 1973 (Act No. VIIL of 1973). The words "the Supreme Court" were substituted. for the words "any High Court" by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act. 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973).
